column4: i did *sudo mount -o /dev/hdc /media/cdrom0* and i got *Mount: block device /dev/hdc is write protected, mounting read only. Mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hdc, missing codepage or helper program, or other error.*
-o requires an argument
are you actually mounting a CDROM?
i'm trying to mount the disk so i can write to it.
what actually is it though?
if it's an NTFS disk, you can't really write to it
ok, what *exactly* are you trying to do?
why are you trying to mount the CD if you want to burn stuff to it?
becasue the cd rom drive is not showing up when i try to burn to disk
then you have some other problem
you can't mount a blank cd
ok, how should i go about getting stuff off this computer
have you got a USB drive?
yes
stick it on that, then
but the usb drives are not mounting either when i put in the pen drive
hmm
stick the USB drive in and at a terminal type "dmesg"
see if it mentions anything about SCSI disks, or "/dev/sd<something>"
i don't see anything for scsi disks, but i got errors for hdc
i have a copy of DSL laying around, should i go through dsl and grab the files i need>
type "mount" and pastebin the result
